in Brazil was carried out in 1872 and recorded a population of 9,930,478.<sup id="cite_ref-325" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-325">[325]</a></sup> From 1880 to 1930, 4 million Europeans arrived.<sup id="cite_ref-326" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-326">[326]</a></sup> Brazil\'s population increased significantly between 1940 and 1970, because of a decline in the <a href="/wiki/Mortality_rate" title="Mortality rate">mortality rate</a>, even though the <a href="/wiki/Birth_rate" title="Birth rate">birth rate</a> underwent a slight decline. In the 1940s the annual <a href="/wiki/Population_growth" title="Population growth">population growth rate</a> was 2.4%, rising to 3.0% in the 1950s and remaining at 2.9% in the 1960s, as life expectancy rose from 44 to 54 years<sup id="cite_ref-327" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-327">[327]</a></sup> and to 72.6 years in 2007.<sup id="cite_ref-328" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-328">[328]</a></sup> It has been steadily falling since the 1960s, from 3.04% per year between 1950 and 1960 to 1.05% in 2008 and is expected to fall to a negative value of&#160;\xe2\x80\x930.29% by 2050<sup id="cite_ref-329" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-329">[329]</a></sup> thus completing the <a href="/wiki/Demographic_transition" title="Demographic transition">demographic transition</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-330" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-330">[330]</a></sup></p>\n<p>In 2008, the illiteracy rate was 11.48%<sup id="cite_ref-331" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-331">[331]</a></sup> and among the <a href="/wiki/Youth_in_Brazil" title="Youth in Brazil">youth</a> (ages 15\xe2\x80\x9319) 1.74%. It was highest (20.30%) in the Northeast, which had a large proportion of rural poor.<sup id="cite_ref-332" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-332">[332]</a></sup> Illiteracy was high (24.18%) among the rural population and lower (9.05%) among the urban population.<sup id="cite_ref-333" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-333">[333]</a></sup></p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Race_and_ethnicity">Race and ethnicity</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Race_and_ethnicity_in_Brazil" title="Race and ethnicity in Brazil">Race and ethnicity in Brazil</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tleft">\n<div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Fachada_do_Museu_da_Imigra%C3%A7%C3%A3o_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Fachada_do_Museu_da_Imigra%C3%A7%C3%A3o_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo.JPG/220px-Fachada_do_Museu_da_Imigra%C3%A7%C3%A3o_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo.JPG" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Fachada_do_Museu_da_Imigra%C3%A7%C3%A3o_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo.JPG/330px-Fachada_do_Museu_da_Imigra%C3%A7%C3%A3o_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Fachada_do_Museu_da_Imigra%C3%A7%C3%A3o_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo.JPG/440px-Fachada_do_Museu_da_Imigra%C3%A7%C3%A3o_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo.JPG 2x" data-file-width="5184" data-file-height="3456" /></a>\n<div class="thumbcaption">\n<div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Fachada_do_Museu_da_Imigra%C3%A7%C3%A3o_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>\nMuseum of Immigration of the <a href="/wiki/State_of_S%C3%A3o_Paulo" class="mw-redirect" title="State of S\xc3\xa3o Paulo">State of S\xc3\xa3o Paulo</a> in the neighborhood of <a href="/wiki/Mooca" class="mw-disambig" title="Mooca">Mooca</a>, in <a href="/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Paulo_city" class="mw-redirect" title="S\xc3\xa3o Paulo city">S\xc3\xa3o Paulo city</a>.</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<p>According to the <a href="/wiki/Brazilian_Institute_of_Geography_and_Statistics" title="Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics">National Research by Household Sample</a> (PNAD) of 2008, 48.43% of the population (about 92 million) described themselves as <a href="/wiki/White_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="White Brazilian">White</a>; 43.80% (about 83 million) as <a href="/wiki/Brown_(racial_classification)#Pardos_in_Brazil" title="Brown (racial classification)">Pardo</a> (<a href="/wiki/Brown_people" class="mw-redirect" title="Brown people">brown</a>), 6.84% (about 13 million) as <a href="/wiki/Black_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="Black Brazilian">Black</a>; 0.58% (about 1.1 million) as <a href="/wiki/Asian_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="Asian Brazilian">Asian</a>; and 0.28% (about 536 thousand) as <a href="/wiki/Indigenous_peoples_in_Brazil" title="Indigenous peoples in Brazil">Amerindian</a> (officially called <i>ind\xc3\xadgena</i>, Indigenous), while 0.07% (about 130 thousand) did not declare their race.<sup id="cite_ref-PNADIBGE_334-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PNADIBGE-334">[334]</a></sup></p>\n<p>In 2007, the <a href="/wiki/Funda%C3%A7%C3%A3o_Nacional_do_%C3%8Dndio" title="Funda\xc3\xa7\xc3\xa3o Nacional do \xc3\x8dndio">National Indian Foundation</a> estimated that Brazil has 67 different uncontacted tribes, up from their estimate of 40 in 2005. Brazil is believed to have the largest number of <a href="/wiki/Uncontacted_peoples" title="Uncontacted peoples">uncontacted peoples</a> in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-335" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-335">[335]</a></sup></p>\n<p>Since the arrival of the Portuguese in 1500, considerable <a href="/wiki/Miscegenation" title="Miscegenation">miscegenation</a> between Amerindians, Europeans, and Africans has taken place in all regions of the country (with European ancestry being dominant nationwide according to the vast majority of all autosomal studies undertaken covering the entire population, accounting for between 65% to 77%).<sup id="cite_ref-alvaro.com.br_336-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-alvaro.com.br-336">[336]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-www1.folha.uol.com.br_337-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-www1.folha.uol.com.br-337">[337]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-bdtd.bce.unb.br_338-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bdtd.bce.unb.br-338">[338]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-plosone.org_339-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-plosone.org-339">[339]</a></sup></p>\n<div class="thumb tright" style="">\n<div class="thumbinner" style="width:200px">\n<div style="background-color:white;margin:auto;position:relative;width:200px;height:200px;overflow:hidden;border-radius:100px;border:1px solid black">\n<div class="transborder" style="position:absolute;width:100px;line-height:0;left:100px; top:100px; border-width:100px 0 0 15915.284869156px; border-left-color:Red"></div>\n<div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 200px 100px 0;border-color:Red"></div>\n<div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 100px 200px 0;border-color:Red"></div>\n<div class="transborder" style="position:absolute;width:100px;line-height:0;left:100px; top:100px; border-width:100px 0 0 3182.0515953785px; border-left-color:#FFE135"></div>\n<div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 200px 100px 0;border-color:#FFE135"></div>\n<div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 100px 200px 0;border-color:#FFE135"></div>\n<div class="transborder" style="position:absolute;width:100px;line-height:0;left:100px; top:100px; border-width:100px 0 0 991.36510217707px; border-left-color:MediumAquamarine"></div>\n<div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 200px 100px 0;border-color:MediumAquamarine"></div>\n<div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 100px 200px 0;border-color:MediumAquamarine"></div>\n<div class="transborder" style="position:absolute;width:100px;line-height:0;left:100px; top:100px; border-width:100px 0 0 153.28270598844px; border-left-color:#9966CC"></div>\n<div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 200px 100px 0;border-color:#9966CC"></div>\n<div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;left:0;top:0;border-width:0 100px 200px 0;border-color:#9966CC"></div>\n<div class="transborder" style="position:absolute;width:100px;line-height:0;right:100px; top:0; border-width:0 687.15418461366px 100px 0; border-right-color:LightBlue"></div>\n<div style="position:absolute;line-height:0;border-style:solid;right:0;top:0;border-width:0 100px 100px 0;border-color:LightBlue"></div>\n</div>\n<div class="thumbcaption">\n<p><a href="/wiki/Race_and_ethnicity_in_Brazil" title="Race and ethnicity in Brazil">Race and ethnicity in Brazil</a><sup id="cite_ref-IBGE_Censo_de_2000_340-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-IBGE_Censo_de_2000-340">[340]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Etnias_Censo_2010_341-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Etnias_Censo_2010-341">[341]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-342" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-342">[342]</a></sup></p>\n<div class="legend" style="-webkit-column-break-inside: avoid;page-break-inside: avoid;break-inside: avoid-column"><span class="legend-color" style="display:inline-block; width:1.5em; height:1.5em; margin:1px 0; border:1px solid black; background-color:LightBlue; color:black; font-size:100%; text-align:center;">&#160;</span>&#160;<a href="/wiki/White_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="White Brazilian">White</a> (47.7%)</div>\n<div class="legend" style="-webkit-column-break-inside: avoid;page-break-inside: avoid;break-inside: avoid-column"><span class="legend-color" style="display:inline-block; width:1.5em; height:1.5em; margin:1px 0; border:1px solid black; background-color: #9966CC; color:black; font-size:100%; text-align:center;">&#160;</span>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Pardo_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="Pardo Brazilian">Pardo</a> (<a href="/wiki/Multiracial#Brazil" title="Multiracial">Multiracial</a>) (43.1%)</div>\n<div class="legend" style="-webkit-column-break-inside: avoid;page-break-inside: avoid;break-inside: avoid-column"><span class="legend-color" style="display:inline-block; width:1.5em; height:1.5em; margin:1px 0; border:1px solid black; background-color:MediumAquamarine; color:black; font-size:100%; text-align:center;">&#160;</span>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Black_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="Black Brazilian">Black</a> (7.6%)</div>\n<div class="legend" style="-webkit-column-break-inside: avoid;page-break-inside: avoid;break-inside: avoid-column"><span class="legend-color" style="display:inline-block; width:1.5em; height:1.5em; margin:1px 0; border:1px solid black; background-color: #FFE135; color:black; font-size:100%; text-align:center;">&#160;</span>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Asian_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="Asian Brazilian">Asian</a> (1.1%)</div>\n<div class="legend" style="-webkit-column-break-inside: avoid;page-break-inside: avoid;break-inside: avoid-column"><span class="legend-color" style="display:inline-block; width:1.5em; height:1.5em; margin:1px 0; border:1px solid black; background-color:Red; color:black; font-size:100%; text-align:center;">&#160;</span>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Indigenous_peoples_in_Brazil" title="Indigenous peoples in Brazil">Natives</a> (0.4%)</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<p>Brazilian society is more <a href="/wiki/Social_issues_in_Brazil" title="Social issues in Brazil">markedly divided by social class lines</a>, although a high <a href="/wiki/Income_inequality_in_Brazil" title="Income inequality in Brazil">income disparity</a> is found <a href="/wiki/Social_apartheid_in_Brazil" title="Social apartheid in Brazil">between race groups</a>, so <a href="/wiki/Racism" title="Racism">racism</a> and <a href="/wiki/Class_discrimination" title="Class discrimination">classism</a> can be conflated. Socially significant closeness to one racial group <a href="/wiki/Race_in_Brazil" class="mw-redirect" title="Race in Brazil">is taken in account</a> more in the basis of appearance (<a href="/wiki/Phenotype" title="Phenotype">phenotypes</a>) rather than ancestry, to the extent that full <a href="/wiki/Sibling" title="Sibling">siblings</a> can pertain to different "racial" groups.<sup id="cite_ref-343" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-343">[343]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Socioeconomic_status" title="Socioeconomic status">Socioeconomic</a> factors are also significant, because a minority of <i><a href="/wiki/Pardo" title="Pardo">pardos</a></i> are likely to start declaring themselves White or Black if socially upward.<sup id="cite_ref-344" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-344">[344]</a></sup> Skin color and facial features do not line quite well with ancestry (usually, Afro-Brazilians are evenly mixed and European ancestry is dominant in Whites and <i>pardos</i> with a significant non-European contribution, but the individual variation is great).<sup id="cite_ref-plosone.org_339-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-plosone.org-339">[339]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-afrobras_345-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-afrobras-345">[345]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-346" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-346">[346]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-347" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-347">[347]</a></sup></p>\n<p>The brown population (officially called <i><a href="/wiki/Pardo" title="Pardo">pardo</a></i> in Portuguese, also colloquially <i><a href="https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/moreno" class="extiw" title="wikt:moreno">moreno</a></i>)<sup id="cite_ref-Coelho_1996.2C_p..C2.A0268_348-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Coelho_1996.2C_p..C2.A0268-348">[348]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Vesentini_1988.2C_p..C2.A0117_349-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Vesentini_1988.2C_p..C2.A0117-349">[349]</a></sup> is a broad category that includes <i><a href="/wiki/Caboclo" title="Caboclo">caboclos</a></i> (assimilated Amerindians in general, and descendants of Whites and Natives), <i><a href="/wiki/Mulatto" title="Mulatto">mulatos</a></i> (descendants of primarily Whites and Afro-Brazilians) and <i><a href="/wiki/Zambo" title="Zambo">cafuzos</a></i> (descendants of Afro-Brazilians and Natives).<sup id="cite_ref-Coelho_1996.2C_p..C2.A0268_348-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Coelho_1996.2C_p..C2.A0268-348">[348]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Vesentini_1988.2C_p..C2.A0117_349-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Vesentini_1988.2C_p..C2.A0117-349">[349]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-350" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-350">[350]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-351" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-351">[351]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Moreira_1981.2C_p..C2.A0108_352-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Moreira_1981.2C_p..C2.A0108-352">[352]</a></sup> People of considerable Amerindian ancestry form the majority of the population in the Northern, Northeastern and Center-Western regions.<sup id="cite_ref-353" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-353">[353]</a></sup></p>\n<p>Higher percents of Blacks, mulattoes and tri-racials can be found in the eastern coast of the Northeastern region from Bahia to Para\xc3\xadba<sup id="cite_ref-Moreira_1981.2C_p..C2.A0108_352-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Moreira_1981.2C_p..C2.A0108-352">[352]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-354" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-354">[354]</a></sup> and also in northern Maranh\xc3\xa3o,<sup id="cite_ref-355" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-355">[355]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-356" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-356">[356]</a></sup> southern Minas Gerais<sup id="cite_ref-Azevedo_1971.2C_p..C2.A0161_357-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Azevedo_1971.2C_p..C2.A0161-357">[357]</a></sup> and in eastern Rio de Janeiro.<sup id="cite_ref-Moreira_1981.2C_p..C2.A0108_352-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Moreira_1981.2C_p..C2.A0108-352">[352]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Azevedo_1971.2C_p..C2.A0161_357-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Azevedo_1971.2C_p..C2.A0161-357">[357]</a></sup> From the 19th century, Brazil opened its borders to <a href="/wiki/Immigration_to_Brazil" title="Immigration to Brazil">immigration</a>. About five million people from over 60 countries migrated to Brazil between 1808 and 1972, most of them of <a href="/wiki/Portuguese_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="Portuguese Brazilian">Portuguese</a>, <a href="/wiki/Italian_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="Italian Brazilian">Italian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brazilians_of_Spanish_descent" class="mw-redirect" title="Brazilians of Spanish descent">Spanish</a>, <a href="/wiki/German_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="German Brazilian">German</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ukrainian_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="Ukrainian Brazilian">Ukrainian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Polish_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="Polish Brazilian">Polish</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jewish_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="Jewish Brazilian">Jewish</a>, <a href="/wiki/Russians_in_Brazil" class="mw-redirect" title="Russians in Brazil">Russian</a>, <a href="/wiki/Chinese_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="Chinese Brazilian">Chinese</a>, <a href="/wiki/Japanese_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="Japanese Brazilian">Japanese</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Arab_Brazilian" class="mw-redirect" title="Arab Brazilian">Arab</a> origin.<sup id="cite_ref-358" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-358">[358]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-359" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-359">[359]</a></sup></p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Religion">Religion</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Religion_in_Brazil" title="Religion in Brazil">Religion in Brazil</a></div>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Roman_Catholicism_in_Brazil" class="mw-redirect" title="Roman Catholicism in Brazil">Roman Catholicism in Brazil</a> and <a href="/wiki/Protestantism_in_Brazil" title="Protestantism in Brazil">Protestantism in Brazil</a></div>\n<div class="barbox tleft" style="overflow-x: auto;">\n<div style="border:1px solid silver; font-size:88%; padding:0.4em; width:285px; background: white;">\n<table style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">\n<tr style="background:#ddd">\n<th colspan="5"><a href="/wiki/Religion_in_Brazil" title="Religion in Brazil">Religion in Brazil</a> <small>(2010 Census)</small></th>\n</tr>\n<tr style="font-size:88%; height:4px;">\n<td style="padding:0 4px;">Religion</td>\n<td style="padding:0 4px; text-align:right;"></td>\n<td style="width:100px;"></td>\n<td style="padding:0 4px; width:1em; text-align:right;">Percent</td>\n<td style="padding:0 4px; text-align:right;"></td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Roman_Catholicism_in_Brazil" class="mw-redirect" title="Roman Catholicism in Brazil">Roman Catholicism</a></td>\n<td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">\n<div style="background:lightblue; width:64.6%; overflow: hidden;">&#160;\xe2\x80\x89</div>\n</td>\n<td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">64.6%</td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Protestantism_in_Brazil" title="Protestantism in Brazil">Protestantism</a></td>\n<td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">\n<div style="background:blue; width:22.2%; overflow: hidden;">&#160;\xe2\x80\x89</div>\n</td>\n<td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">22.2%</td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Irreligion" title="Irreligion">No religion</a></td>\n<td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">\n<div style="background:lightgray; width:8.0%; overflow: hidden;">&#160;\xe2\x80\x89</div>\n</td>\n<td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">8.0%</td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;"><a href="/wiki/Spiritism" title="Spiritism">Spiritism</a></td>\n<td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">\n<div style="background:purple; width:2.0%; overflow: hidden;">&#160;\xe2\x80\x89</div>\n</td>\n<td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">2.0%</td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; min-width: 8em;">Others</td>\n<td style="width: 100px; border-left: solid 1px silver; border-right: solid 1px silver;">\n<div style="background:yellow; width:3.2%; overflow: hidden;">&#160;\xe2\x80\x89</div>\n</td>\n<td colspan="2" style="padding-left: 0.4em; padding-right: 0.4em; text-align: right;">3.2%</td>\n</tr>\n</table>\n</div>\n</div>\n<p>Religion in Brazil was formed from the meeting of the Catholic Church with the religious traditions of enslaved African peoples and indigenous peoples.<sup id="cite_ref-BoyleSheen2013_360-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BoyleSheen2013-360">[360]</a></sup> This confluence of faiths during the Portuguese colonization of Brazil led to the development of a diverse array of syncretistic practices within the overarching umbrella of Brazilian Catholic Church, characterized by traditional Portuguese festivities,<sup id="cite_ref-georgetown1_361-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-georgetown1-361">[361]</a></sup> and in some instances, <a href="/wiki/Allan_Kardec" title="Allan Kardec">Allan Kardec</a>\'s <a href="/wiki/Spiritism" title="Spiritism">Spiritism</a> (a religion which incorporates elements of <a href="/wiki/Spiritualism" title="Spiritualism">spiritualism</a> and Christianity). Religious pluralism increased during the 20th century,<sup id="cite_ref-Morris2006a_362-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Morris2006a-362">[362]</a></sup> and the Protestant community has grown to include over 22% of the population.<sup id="cite_ref-JeynesRobinson2012_363-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-JeynesRobinson2012-363">[363]</a></sup> The most common Protestant denominations are <a href="/wiki/Pentecostalism" title="Pentecostalism">Pentecostal</a> and <a href="/wiki/Evangelicalism" title="Evangelicalism">Evangelical</a> ones. Other Protestant branches with a notable presence in the country include the <a href="/wiki/Baptists" title="Baptists">Baptists</a>, <a href="/wiki/Seventh-day_Adventist_Church" title="Seventh-day Adventist Church">Seventh-day Adventists</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lutheranism" title="Lutheranism">Lutherans</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Calvinism" title="Calvinism">Reformed tradition</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-364" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-364">[364]</a></sup></p>\n<div class="thumb tmulti tright">\n<div class="thumbinner" style="width:422px;max-width:422px">\n<div class="tsingle" style="float:left;margin:1px;width:206px;max-width:206px">\n<div class="thumbimage"><a href="/wiki/File:1_cristor_redentor_2014.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a1/1_cristor_redentor_2014.jpg/204px-1_cristor_redentor_2014.jpg" width="204" height="136" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a1/1_cristor_redentor_2014.jpg/306px-1_cristor_redentor_2014.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a1/1_cristor_redentor_2014.jpg/408px-1_cristor_redentor_2014.jpg 2x" data-file-width="6432" data-file-height="4300" /></a></div>\n<div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left">The <a href="/wiki/Christ_the_Redeemer_(statue)" title="Christ the Redeemer (statue)">Christ the Redeemer</a> statue in <a href="/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro" title="Rio de Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a> is one of the most famous religious statues worldwide<sup id="cite_ref-366" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-366">[366]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-367" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-367">[367]</a></sup></div>\n</div>\n<div class="tsingle" style="float:left;margin:1px;width:212px;max-width:212px">\n<div class="thumbimage"><a href="/wiki/File:Basilica_of_the_National_Shrine_of_Our_Lady_of_Aparecida,_2007.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/Basilica_of_the_National_Shrine_of_Our_Lady_of_Aparecida%2C_2007.jpg/210px-Basilica_of_the_National_Shrine_of_Our_Lady_of_Aparecida%2C_2007.jpg" width="210" height="136" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/Basilica_of_the_National_Shrine_of_Our_Lady_of_Aparecida%2C_2007.jpg/315px-Basilica_of_the_National_Shrine_of_Our_Lady_of_Aparecida%2C_2007.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/Basilica_of_the_National_Shrine_of_Our_Lady_of_Aparecida%2C_2007.jpg/420px-Basilica_of_the_National_Shrine_of_Our_Lady_of_Aparecida%2C_2007.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2480" data-file-height="1611" /></a></div>\n<div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left"><a href="/wiki/Basilica_of_the_National_Shrine_of_Our_Lady_of_Aparecida" title="Basilica of the National Shrine of Our Lady of Aparecida">Basilica of the National Shrine of Our Lady of Aparecida</a> in <a href="/wiki/Aparecida_do_Norte" class="mw-redirect" title="Aparecida do Norte">Aparecida do Norte</a>, <a href="/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Paulo_(state)" title="S\xc3\xa3o Paulo (state)">S\xc3\xa3o Paulo</a>, is the second largest <a href="/wiki/Roman_Catholicism_in_Brazil" class="mw-redirect" title="Roman Catholicism in Brazil">Catholic</a> church in the world<sup id="cite_ref-365" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-365">[365]</a></sup></div>\n</div>\n<div style="clear:left"></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<p><a href="/wiki/Roman_Catholicism" class="mw-redirect" title="Roman Catholicism">Roman Catholicism</a> is the country\'s predominant faith. Brazil has the world\'s largest Catholic population.<sup id="cite_ref-USDS_368-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-USDS-368">[368]</a></sup> According to the 2000 Demographic Census (the PNAD survey does not inquire about religion), 73.57% of the population followed <a href="/wiki/Roman_Catholicism_in_Brazil" class="mw-redirect" title="Roman Catholicism in Brazil">Roman Catholicism</a>; 15.41% <a href="/wiki/Protestantism_in_Brazil" title="Protestantism in Brazil">Protestantism</a>; 1.33% Kardecist spiritism; 1.22% other Christian denominations; 0.31% Afro-Brazilian religions; 0.13% <a href="/wiki/Buddhism" title="Buddhism">Buddhism</a>; 0.05% <a href="/wiki/Judaism" title="Judaism">Judaism</a>; 0.02% <a href="/wiki/Islam_in_Brazil" title="Islam in Brazil">Islam</a>; 0.01% Amerindian religions; 0.59% other religions, undeclared or undetermined; while 7.35% have no religion.<sup id="cite_ref-Censo2000Religiao_369-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Censo2000Religiao-369">[369]</a></sup></p>\n<p>However, in the last ten years Protestantism, particularly Pentecostalism and Evangelicalism, has spread in Brazil, while the proportion of Catholics has dropped significantly.<sup id="cite_ref-georgetown2_370-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-georgetown2-370">[370]</a></sup> After Protestantism, individuals professing no religion are also a significant group, exceeding 7% of the population as of the 2000 census. The cities of <a href="/wiki/Boa_Vista,_Roraima" title="Boa Vista, Roraima">Boa Vista</a>, <a href="/wiki/Salvador,_Bahia" title="Salvador, Bahia">Salvador</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Porto_Velho" title="Porto Velho">Porto Velho</a> have the greatest proportion of <a href="/wiki/Irreligion" title="Irreligion">Irreligious</a> residents in Brazil. <a href="/wiki/Teresina" title="Teresina">Teresina</a>, <a href="/wiki/Fortaleza" title="Fortaleza">Fortaleza</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Florian%C3%B3polis" title="Florian\xc3\xb3polis">Florian\xc3\xb3polis</a> were the most Roman Catholic in the country.<sup id="cite_ref-FGV_no_G1_371-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FGV_no_G1-371">[371]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Greater_Rio_de_Janeiro" title="Greater Rio de Janeiro">Greater Rio de Janeiro</a>, not including the <a href="/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro" title="Rio de Janeiro">city proper</a>, is the most irreligious and least Roman Catholic Brazilian periphery, while <a href="/wiki/Greater_Porto_Alegre" title="Greater Porto Alegre">Greater Porto Alegre</a> and Greater <a href="/wiki/Fortaleza" title="Fortaleza">Fortaleza</a> are on the opposite sides of the lists, respectively.<sup id="cite_ref-FGV_no_G1_371-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FGV_no_G1-371">[371]</a></sup></p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Urbanization">Urbanization</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/List_of_largest_cities_in_Brazil" title="List of largest cities in Brazil">List of largest cities in Brazil</a> and <a href="/wiki/Municipalities_of_Brazil" title="Municipalities of Brazil">Municipalities of Brazil</a></div>\n<p>According to IBGE (Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics) urban areas already concentrate 84.35% of the population, while the Southeast region remains the most populated one, with over 80 million inhabitants.<sup id="cite_ref-372" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-372">[372]</a></sup> The largest urban agglomerations in Brazil are <a href="/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Paulo" title="S\xc3\xa3o Paulo">S\xc3\xa3o Paulo</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro" title="Rio de Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Belo_Horizonte" title="Belo Horizonte">Belo Horizonte</a> \xe2\x80\x93 all in the Southeastern Region \xe2\x80\x93 with 21.1, 12.3, and 5.1&#160;million inhabitants respectively.<sup id="cite_ref-concentra.C3.A7.C3.B5es_urbanas_373-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-concentra.C3.A7.C3.B5es_urbanas-373">[373]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-374" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-374">[374]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-375" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-375">[375]</a></sup> The majority of state capitals are the largest cities in their states, except for <a href="/wiki/Vit%C3%B3ria,_Brazil" class="mw-redirect" title="Vit\xc3\xb3ria, Brazil">Vit\xc3\xb3ria</a>, the capital of <a href="/wiki/Esp%C3%ADrito_Santo" title="Esp\xc3\xadrito Santo">Esp\xc3\xadrito Santo</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Florian%C3%B3polis" title="Florian\xc3\xb3polis">Florian\xc3\xb3polis</a>, the capital of Santa Catarina.<sup id="cite_ref-376" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-376">[376]</a></sup></p>\n<table class="navbox">\n<tr>\n<th colspan="10" class="navbox-title">\n<div style="float:right; width:6em; height:2.6em">&#160;</div>\n<div class="plainlinks hlist navbar mini" style="float: left;height:2.6em;">\n<ul>\n<li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Largest_urban_agglomerations_in_Brazil" title="Template:Largest urban agglomerations in Brazil"><abbr title="View this this template">t</abbr></a></li>\n<li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Largest_urban_agglomerations_in_Brazil&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li>\n</ul>\n</div>\n<div style="height:2.6em;line-height:1.3em;"><span style="font-size:110%;">Largest urban agglomerations in Brazil</span><br />\n<span style="font-weight:normal;">2016 <a href="/wiki/Brazilian_Institute_of_Geography_and_Statistics" title="Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics">Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics</a> estimates<sup id="cite_ref-concentra.C3.A7.C3.B5es_urbanas_373-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-concentra.C3.A7.C3.B5es_urbanas-373">[373]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-377" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-377">[377]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-378" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-378">[378]</a></sup></span></div>\n</th>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<th></th>\n<th><a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Brazil_by_population" class="mw-redirect" title="List of cities in Brazil by population">Rank</a></th>\n<th><a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Brazil" class="mw-redirect" title="List of cities in Brazil">Name</a></th>\n<th><a href="/wiki/States_of_Brazil" title="States of Brazil">State</a></th>\n<th><a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Brazil_by_population" class="mw-redirect" title="List of cities in Brazil by population">Pop.</a></th>\n<th><a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Brazil_by_population" class="mw-redirect" title="List of cities in Brazil by population">Rank</a></th>\n<th><a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Brazil" class="mw-redirect" title="List of cities in Brazil">Name</a></th>\n<th><a href="/wiki/States_of_Brazil" title="States of Brazil">State</a></th>\n<th><a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_Brazil_by_population" class="mw-redirect" title="List of cities in Brazil by population">Pop.</a></th>\n<th></th>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td rowspan="11" style="text-align: center"><a href="/wiki/File:Sampa_ao_entardecer.jpg" class="image" title="S\xc3\xa3o Paulo"><img alt="S\xc3\xa3o Paulo" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Sampa_ao_entardecer.jpg/120px-Sampa_ao_entardecer.jpg" width="120" height="80" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Sampa_ao_entardecer.jpg/180px-Sampa_ao_entardecer.jpg 1.5x, Lu\xc3\xads</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Maranh%C3%A3o" title="Maranh\xc3\xa3o">Maranh\xc3\xa3o</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">1,409,162</td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">8</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Fortaleza" title="Fortaleza">Fortaleza</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a Grande do Norte">Rio Grande do Norte</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">1,333,153</td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">9</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Curitiba" title="Curitiba">Curitiba</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Paran%C3%A1_(state)" title="Paran\xc3\xa1 (state)">Paran\xc3\xa1</a></td>\n<td style="text-align:right;">3,354,869</td>\n<td style="text-align:center;background:#f0f0f0;">19</td>\n<td style="text-align:left;"><a href="/wiki/Macei%C3%B3"
